text: Sir Harold Matthew Evans (28 June 1928 – 23 September 2020) was a British- American journalist and writer. He was editor of The Sunday Times from 1967 to 1981. He also worked for U.S. News & World Report, The Atlantic Monthly, and the New York Daily News. In 1986, he founded Condé Nast Traveler. Evans was honored as a Knight Bachelor in 2004. On 13 June 2011, Evans was appointed editor-at-large of the Reuters news agency. From 2013 until 2019, he was chairman of the European Press Prize jury panel.
